00005 #define _USE_MATH_DEFINES 
00006 #include <math.h>
00007 
00008 #define DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(X) (X * M_PI / 180)
00009 #define MAX_WHEEL_SPEED 125
00010 
00011 MotionController::MotionController(double positionControlScale, double angleControlScale)
00012         : positionProportionalTerm(positionControlScale), angleProportionalTerm(angleControlScale)
00013 {
00014 }
00015 
00016 void MotionController::Control(std::function<Vector3D(clock_t)> controlFunction, clock_t timeOffset, Robot* bot)
00017 {
00018         Control(controlFunction(clock() - timeOffset), bot);
00019 }
00020 
00021 double MotionController::DistanceTo(Vector3D targetPosition, Robot* bot)
00022 {
00023         auto yDiff = targetPosition.y - bot->pos.y;
00024         auto xDiff = targetPosition.x - bot->pos.x;
00025         return sqrt(xDiff*xDiff+yDiff*yDiff);
00026 }
00027 
00028 void MotionController::Control(Vector3D targetPosition, Robot* bot)
00029 {
00030         auto yDiff = targetPosition.y - bot->pos.y;
00031         auto xDiff = targetPosition.x - bot->pos.x;
00032 
00033         double angle;
00034 
00035         if (xDiff == 0)
00036         {
00037                 // directly above or below
00038                 if (fabs(yDiff) == yDiff) // target is below us
00039                         angle = -M_PI_2;
00040                 else // target is above us
00041                         angle = M_PI_2;
00042         }
00043         else
00044                 angle = atan(yDiff/xDiff);
00045         
00046         if (xDiff == 0)
00047         {
00048                 // directly above or below
00049                 if (fabs(yDiff) == yDiff) // target is below us
00050                         angle = -M_PI_2;
00051                 else // target is above us
00052                         angle = M_PI_2;
00053         }
00054         else
00055         {
00056                 angle = atan(yDiff/xDiff);
00057                 if (fabs(xDiff) != xDiff) // xDiff is negative, so target is to the left
00058                         angle = angle + M_PI; // rotate around pi radians to allow for tan function periodicity
00059         }
00060 
00061         auto botAngle = DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(bot->rotation); // Convert the robot angle into radians, which all the C math functions use...
00062 
00063         // Move target angle into robot frame of reference
00064         angle = angle - botAngle;
00065         
00066         // Normalise between pi and -pi
00067         if (angle > M_PI)
00068                 angle -= 2*M_PI;
00069         if (angle < -M_PI)
00070                 angle += 2*M_PI;
00071         
00072         // Set up the turn as required
00073         auto turnSpeed = angle * angleProportionalTerm;
00074         bot->velocityLeft = -turnSpeed;
00075         bot->velocityRight = turnSpeed;
00076         
00077         if (angle < DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(30))
00078         {
00079                 // Work out the forwards speed
00080                 auto distance = sqrt(xDiff*xDiff+yDiff*yDiff);
00081                 auto vel = distance * positionProportionalTerm;
00082                 // Ensure we won't muck up the turn by trying to move too fast forwards
00083                 if (vel + abs(turnSpeed) > MAX_WHEEL_SPEED)
00084                         vel = MAX_WHEEL_SPEED - abs(bot->velocityLeft);
00085         
00086                 // Apply the speed.
00087                 bot->velocityLeft += vel;
00088                 bot->velocityRight += vel;
00089         }
00090         else
00091         {
00092                 bot->velocityLeft *= 10;
00093                 bot->velocityRight *= 10;
00094         }
00095 }
